data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_1
data.value: that you can execute process commands in two ways: entering the executable file name directly, and using the 'exec' command?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_2
data.value: that you can lock your screen using the 'lockscreen' command?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_3
data.value: that you can build your own kernel modifications using C# and Visual Basic?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_4
data.value: that you can use multiple commands using the semicolon between commands?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_5
data.value: that you can escape double quotes inside the quoted arguments when executing commands?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_6
data.value: that you can change the kernel settings using the 'settings' command?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_7
data.value: that you can save your screen using the 'savescreen' command?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_8
data.value: that you can report bugs to us by going to Nitrocid's GitHub project page?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_9
data.value: that you can make a shortcut to your desired command using the 'alias' command?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_10
data.value: that you can build your own splash screen using C# and Visual Basic?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_11
data.value: that you can install extra addons to make your kernel more useful and amusing?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_12
data.value: that you can make your own awesome themes using the 'mktheme' command?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_13
data.value: that you can change your kernel colours by either using the 'settings' command or by using one of the pre-built themes?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_14
data.value: that you can reset your kernel to the factory defaults using the 'reset' argument?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_15
data.value: that you can access our extensive documentation at our GitBook page?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_16
data.value: that long term releases are supported for five years for main support, and three years for security updates?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_17
data.value: that 0.0.1 was the very first version of Nitrocid KS that was released on February 22, 2018?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_18
data.value: that the 0.0.24.x series was the only version series that held the API v2.1 version?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_19
data.value: that short term releases are supported for just nine months?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_20
data.value: that 0.1.x series is backwards-incompatible with 0.0.24.x series or older?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_21
data.value: that you can run Nitrocid KS on Linux, macOS, and Android?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_22
data.value: that you can refer to the API documentation to help you make your mods?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_23
data.value: that you can get several of the awesome games, like Hangman and ShipDuet, by installing the extra addons?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_24
data.value: that, in Meteor, if you crash with a red meteor storm, your spaceship crashes?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_25
data.value: that you can convert your kernel to information centres using the docking feature?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_26
data.value: that you can make user groups to organise user accounts?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_27
data.value: that if you're a member of a group that grants certain permissions, you're allowed to perform such operations?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_28
data.value: that you can change your kernel time zone without affecting your host system?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_29
data.value: that you can use the interactive text and hex editor to save time?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_30
data.value: that the oldest text editor known to be working with the first Unix system is ed, the earliest text editor released on 1973 shipped with the Unix system found on a PDP-7 at AT&T Bell Labs?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_31
data.value: that you can also force edit command to launch the editor in a specific type?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_32
data.value: that the interactive text editor attempts to simulate the most basic features of the most popular Unix text editors, vi and vim?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_33
data.value: that unless you know what you're doing with the binary file, editing such file in this way will lead to data corruption or data loss in the targeted file?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_34
data.value: that on Linux systems, the shell is initiated with the help of both the log-in handler and the system initialisation programme, usually found in /sbin/init?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_35
data.value: that you can perform common file operations, such as copying, moving, deleting, editing, and so on?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_36
data.value: that the interactive TUI of a file manager simulates the functionality of Midnight Commander?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_37
data.value: that if the kernel crashes, it usually creates a dump file?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_38
data.value: that you can diagnose the kernel by debugging it using the built-in debug functionality?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_39
data.value: that you can download and upload files directly from the UESH shell?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_40
data.value: that the kernel can be translated even at pre-boot stages by starting it up with the 'lang' argument?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_41
data.value: that you can build your own screensavers by registering them in your mod?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_42
data.value: that the first screensaver that blanked the screen after three minutes of inactivity on the original IBM PCs, scrnsave, was created on 1983 by John Socha?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_43
data.value: that some of the fast-paced screensavers may cause photosensitive seizures?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_44
data.value: that kernel journals are used as boot and shutdown logs?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_45
data.value: that your mods can now become translatable?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_46
data.value: that your mods can communicate with kernel addons and other mods, creating some kind of communication and achieving interoperability?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_47
data.value: that you can connect to the remote debugger and, optionally, to the chat server?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_48
data.value: that you can use the debug shell, which is only available for development versions?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_49
data.value: that your mods can now have their own configuration by registering their associated classes?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_50
data.value: that your mods can register their own shells?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_51
data.value: that your mods can add commands to the existing shells to increase the amount of commands that can be used?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_52
data.value: that your command classes can accurately represent passed arguments and switches?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_53
data.value: that you can query passed switches using the switch management classes found in the kernel API?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_54
data.value: that UESH includes the scripting functionality to facilitate making and running scripts?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_55
data.value: that the shell includes functionality to inhibit cancellation for active applications?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_56
data.value: that Nitrocid is deeply integrated with Terminaux to allow faster and better rendering?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_57
data.value: that you can now resize the interactive applications without worrying that the output gets corrupted?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_58
data.value: that there are commands that ask for user input, which are useful for scripts?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_59
data.value: that you can present your user input question in several ways, such as choice, table, simple, selection, and so on?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_60
data.value: that you can place the placeholders to your text that supports them?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_61
data.value: that you can use different kernel drivers to change how a specific operation works?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_62
data.value: that you can make your own screensavers and splashes in C# or Visual Basic?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_63
data.value: that you can query the host system and the terminal emulator using the kernel platform class?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_64
data.value: that you can ask for a privacy consent prior to doing something sensitive in your mod?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_65
data.value: that you can turn off notifications using the Do Not Disturb feature?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_66
data.value: that you can save notification history using a function found in the notification manager?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_67
data.value: that you can change how random numbers are generated by changing the driver?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_68
data.value: that miscellaneous APIs provide useful functions for your mods?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_69
data.value: This section lets you configure how Tips works.

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_70
data.value: Show kernel tips

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_71
data.value: If enabled, the shell shows you the tips on every login.

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_72
data.value: that you can make bootable programmes using your kernel mods?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_73
data.value: Failed to obtain settings entries.

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_74
data.value: that Nitrocid (Kernel Simulator 0.0.2) called the built-in shell the 'UESH' shell?

data.name: NKS_TIPS_KERNELTIP_75
data.value: that the screensavers were touted to be a solution against screen burn-ins in cathode ray-tube (CRT) or plasma displays?
